intro: Gouldia kaala, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a striking plant native to the tropical regions of Australia. It is a member of the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are dark green and glossy. Gouldia kaala thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
